reviews.review: como dijo cacho: si te agarro con otro te mato, te doy una paliza y despues me escapo

Fun game, difficult sometimes.
Game was a fun experience but some parts get very difficult. Many times you survive a fight and are left at low health just for the next part killing you on loop because you don't have enough health to proceed. On one part a sniper cannot die so you need to take the damage and move on, but if you don't have the health to do it you have to load a much older save.  Despite that I never felt like it was the game's fault that I was struggling.
In summary, game is bullshit, but not unfair.

I'm known by my primary Steam account here: https://steamcommunity.com/id/MoeJama/. I own this game in my alternate account, the one I'm using to write this review.

I played this game back in...late 2019? Well, that doesn't really matter -- what matters is that I wish I had made a review about my UNDYING LOVE for this game sooner. I remember hearing about how good this game was until I thought, "Okay, I gotta play this game...like, NOW." I can truly say that I don't regret spending even a cent on this game one bit. Though the graphics are a little outdated, the game mechanics are very good and the story/plot is VERY intriguing. Everything about this game, from the different worldly settings and unique characters to the broad story line, is awesome and very well-made. I truly admire how Valve's employees really wanted to kick off their growing company by making such an immersive game. Thank you for helping me see the "great beyond" in its true reality, Valve! Great work on this game! :)

Deserving of the praise it gets. While some things in the game haven’t aged well, it is still worth playing. I easily recommend this game to any FPS fan.
Yes I play Half Life how could u tell?
Half life is rated M for Masterpiece
i like to play this game in under 50 minutes.

Very immersive game with a great story which was Valve's first game and first hit game. It's so good that I think it still holds up today even though the graphics would suggest otherwise.

Along with Quake, it is regarded as one of the most influential FPS games because of the amount of mods that the game inspired as well as the way Half-Life immerses the player with small amounts of dialogue, it's great story and the lack of cut scenes.

The Steam version of Half-Life also includes a high quality graphics pack which changes the view model and weapons which is a neat addition for anybody who wants it.

I highly recommend playing Half-Life at least once.
The game holds up really well for being so old. Fun gameplay, level design, and a very interesting story.

I can understand why people consider this game to be one of the best FPS off all time. I want more FPS or shooters like this. I don't what it is called but I call it a Tactical Puzzle Horror Shooter. Love it. To anyone who sees this review, please recommend me some FPS or shooter that play like this.

Awesome and accessible to this day. This game when it came out showed what could be done for story telling in a first person shooter. The fact that it's still playable to the average person today shows it was really well designed. Play this, then Black Mesa to play it with an updated engine and Graphics.
Finally a game i can run at 60 FPS. 10/10

This game is a legend of 1990s as it was marked as a revolution of FPS game at the time. More details were noticeably added to polygon graphic along with more actions performable by characters, including mouth movement while talking. Enemy soldier AI had also become revolutionarily smarter as they were able to take cover when underfired and to dodge grenade when tossed.

Many parts of the game may be dulled as this game is all about survival, pathfinding and fighting monsters. Occasional combats against enemy military soldiers do add more challenge and excitement to the game.

Even though new players are advised to play the remake version, Black Mesa: Definitive Edition, alternatively for better experience on the same storyline, this original version has already been remembered by old timers as one of legends.

One of the best fps ever made, Its just unbelievable to think that 5 years after the original doom game was this.

Un juego que a pesar de ser publicado en 1998 logra revolucionar las aventuras en 3D, gran catalogo de NPC's y de equipamiento, una trama diferente a la de los demás juegos de la época, y añadidos como conversaciones con aliados, y puzzles que van mas allá de buscar llaves para puertas como en Doom o Quake, diseños de niveles casi realistas, aunque innovadores para la ciencia ficción, sin duda mejores que los de Doom, a la par con los de Quake 2. Una banda sonora que sirve tanto como dar vida a un ambiente tenebroso o caótico, tanto como para llenarte de adrenalina luchando contra las fuerzas metálicas, gracias al rock y al metal. Un juego de duracion regular, yo que soy un jugador veterano completo Half-Life en 8 horas como máximo, y es fácil de dominar, siendo la dificultas Difícil como un paseo por el parque, sin mencionar la cantidad abrumadora de munición (imagina tener 133 cartuchos para tu escopeta, o 42 balas .375 para tu revolver). Creo haber lo mencionado lo mas importante. Puntuación: 9/10

Half-Life is great. While most of my hours are on the box set, I can safely say that the port to Steam has not affected it in any way. If you want a true Half-Life experience, then this is it. I personally prefer it to the HL2 series, as it focuses more on story and puzzles than simply showing off the latest physics. With a great military vs Aliens vs Scientist plot and so many unique levels, it has plenty of replayability without becoming boring or repetitive. Even something like the difficulty option changes how the AI acts. It's a good example of a game that can be hard without feeling unfair or infuriating. If you want to get into story based single-player games, this is probably it.
